name: samtools_mpileup
title: Samtools Pileup
summary: Variant calling for SNPs and Indels using Samtools Pileup
description: Samtools pileup takes a set of mapped reads and calls SNP and indels variations from a reference genome, using the mpileup option of samtools.

inputSpec.name: mappings
inputSpec.label: Mappings Object
inputSpec.help: The mapped reads which will be used to call variants from

inputSpec.name: reference
inputSpec.label: Reference Genome
inputSpec.help: The reference genome to call variants against

inputSpec.name: output name
inputSpec.label: Output Name
inputSpec.help: The name of the generated variants object

inputSpec.name: reads_per_job
inputSpec.label: Reads per Job
inputSpec.help: Controls the degree of parallelism. The number of jobs created to run the program will be the total number of reads divided by this

inputSpec.name: disable_probabilistic_realignment
inputSpec.label: No Realignment
inputSpec.help: When this option is selection mpileup will not attempt to realign potentially misaligned reads. Turning this off will increase the false positive rate

inputSpec.name: excessive_mismatch_penalty
inputSpec.label: Mismatch Penalty
inputSpec.help: This coefficient is used to downgrade the mapping quality of reads containing multiple mismatches

inputSpec.name: max_reads_per_position
inputSpec.label: Max Coverage
inputSpec.help: For each position, samtools will consider at most this many reads

inputSpec.name: extended_baq_computation
inputSpec.label: Extend Quality Computation
inputSpec.help: Extra re-computation of base quality for mapped reads. Selecting this will slightly improve sensitivity, especially for MNP, but slightly decrease specifcity

inputSpec.name: minimum_mapping_quality
inputSpec.label: Min Mapping Quality
inputSpec.help: Mapped quality of an alignment must be above this threshold to be considered

inputSpec.name: minimum_base_quality
inputSpec.label: Min Base Quality
inputSpec.help: Base read quality must be above this threshold to be considered

inputSpec.name: bayesian_inference
inputSpec.label: Use Bayesian Model
inputSpec.help: If selected, a bayesian model will be used to call variants. Selecting this will force the option for maximum-likelihood inference for genotypes

inputSpec.name: perform_max_likelihood_inference
inputSpec.label: Use max-likelihood
inputSpec.help: Perform max-likelihood inference only, including estimating the site allele frequency, testing Hardy-Weinberg equlibrium and testing associations with LRT

inputSpec.name: indel_to_snp_ratio
inputSpec.label: Indel:SNP Ratio
inputSpec.help: Assume this ratio for the prior of the ratio of Indels to SNPs

inputSpec.name: variant_probability
inputSpec.label: Variant Call Probability
inputSpec.help: Call a variant if its probability is estimated at greater than this

inputSpec.name: scaled_mutation_rate
inputSpec.label: Mutation Rate
inputSpec.help: Prior used for likelihood of finding variants

inputSpec.name: output_variants_only
inputSpec.label: Output Only Variants
inputSpec.help: If selected, reference calls will not be printed

inputSpec.name: retain_unlikely_alleles
inputSpec.label: Keep Unlikely Alleles
inputSpec.help: If selected, alleles mpileup considers but rejects as unlikely will be retained

inputSpec.name: compress_reference
inputSpec.label: Compress Reference
inputSpec.help: When selected, contiguous rows that are called as reference will be compressed to a single row to save space

inputSpec.name: compress_no_call
inputSpec.label: Compress No-call
inputSpec.help: If selected, contiguous no-calls in the genome will be condensed to one row. This often saves significant space

inputSpec.name: infer_no_call
inputSpec.label: Infer No-call Sites
inputSpec.help: When selected, positions in the reference genome lacking any calls will be explicitly written to the variants object as no-call

inputSpec.name: store_full_vcf
inputSpec.label: Store All VCF Data
inputSpec.help: When selected, extra data beyond that stored in the simplevar variants object will be retained to allow for a full reconstitution of the VCF file

details.upstreamAuthors: Heng Li, Bob Handsaker, Alec Wysoker, Tim Fennell, Jue Ruan, Nils Homer, Gabor Marth, Goncalo Abecasis, Richard Durbin, and 1000 Genome Project Data Processing Subgroup
